Reviews.Title: “good price”
Reviews.Author: mariner20010
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stay at the hotel hul-ku for two nights., the location is excellent close to walmart or 5 avenida, restaurants and the beach which is the best. The hotel don't have parking or anything fancy, but does have wi-fi, tv and ac or fan. the price is very affordable and is very safe .

Reviews.Title: “Hul Ku translates into THE BEST Value in Playa and Quality on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: Will_in_SoCal
Reviews.Content: If I had only known about this Mexican gem when we originally arrived in Playa! And the price was the best value that we found in Playa by far at $450 pesos for a double without AC, $550 pesos for a double with AC. Since we were there in early March, AC wasn't needed although that would probably be an issue during the summer. That compares with others a minimum of $400 with AC. Furthermore, the nights that we stayed were quiet and there was no problem with noise even during a holiday. The hotel is four blocks from the beach and close to the nightlife. Just remember that at these prices, don't expect a continental breakfast or shampoo. On the other hand, the owner has spared no expense to make this hotel into a hanging garden in the midst of an otherwise rundown neighborhood. The rooms are well kept and the bathrooms functioned excellently. The hotel is cleaned thoroughly every morning. There is a cozy swimming pool and fountains everywhere. There are only three small critiques I want to make. First, the Internet connection was only available in the common areas and was a bit week although they will work well overall so long as your PC has adequate battery power.. The second is that the most room plugs are not designed with grounds. However, ask the thoughtful manager and she will provide you with an extension adapter at no extra charge. Finally, they only provide you two towels. In order to have more, however, all you need do is ask.

Reviews.Title: “off the beaten track and quiet”
Reviews.Author: africanomore
Reviews.Content: It's my 2nd time staying at this hotel in a year. What I like the most about it is that it's just a few blocks from everything but not in the heart of it, so it's nice & quiet. The rooms are built around a large courtyard with lots of greenery, a few parakeets (caged) and a couple fountains. This gives it a nice, calm, "oasis in the city" feel. The only caveat is that because the rooms all face this communal space, if people are partying on one of the room's balconies, you will hear it. And balconies are shared between 2 rooms, which I imagine could be a problem but never has been for me.The rooms are basic (no fridge), but clean and spacious. Lighting is poor, but not really an issue. Don't expect to watch anything on TV other than static. The staff are pretty helpful & friendly too. It was about 40$ a night.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet and charming hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Hbois
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 5 nights. Location is great, 5 minutes to the beach and to everything else.( wallmart, colectivos, bus stations, restaurants ...) Not noisy and a safe place. The room was great, 3 single beds, a clean bathroom, and a small kitchen with a refrigerator a microwave and an electric oven. They were helpful and easy going. They kept our bags and lets us take a shower at the reception on the day we were leaving. (after check-out) There is a pool but since there is not much light getting through the vegetation, the water is very cold. The place is beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and charming Mexican hotel”
Reviews.Author: ugeauxgirl
Reviews.Content: That being said, it is a mexican hotel- the water pressure wasn't great and the beds were hard, but that wasn't a problem for us. It was clean and charming and we would go back. We didn't have reservations and showed up Easter Week and got a great deal. It is a few blocks from town, but the pool and courtyard are wonderfully tropical, peaceful and relaxing. Its near El Fogon, an awesome restaurant, which didn't hurt. very affordable option.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: performanceboy
Reviews.Content: We stumbled across this little oasis and were surprised by it's value and cleanliness. We liked that it was just off the beaten path. The gate was locked at night and we never felt unsafe. the room was clean, the staff was polite and helpful. It was tucked away from the ruckus of the main drag down by the beach and close to clean and friendly restaurants. We would stay there again if we ever return to Playa Del Carmen. As mentioned, it takes a few minutes for the hot water, but once it arrives there is not rush to finish as there was plenty. The young man who cleaned the rooms was polite and artistic with the towels. The court yard was beautiful and peaceful. We loved it.
